  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Generalist",
  "description": "Fave consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Generalist

Job Location:&nbsp;Garki 2, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time -&nbsp;Monday &ndash; Saturday (9am-5pm)

Job Summary


	We&#39;re looking for a high-performing professional&nbsp;HR Generalist&nbsp;to join our fast-paced FMCG team!
	The HR/Admin Officer is a key support role responsible for managing employee lifecycle activities, ensuring compliance with Nigerian labor laws, and overseeing daily administrative operations.
	Reporting to the Managing Director, the officer will balance HR and admin duties within a small to mid-sized team.
	This role is vital for fostering a motivated workforce, streamlining office processes, and driving growth across the company&rsquo;s e-commerce, warehousing, and digital marketing sectors.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Ability to conduct recruitment, Talent hunts and Talent retention, Lead recruitment and onboarding processes
	Manage end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and employee lifecycle processes.
	Maintain employee records and ensure HR policy compliance.
	Handle employee relations, grievances, and disciplinary processes professionally.
	Support performance management and training initiatives.
	Collaborate with management to drive employee engagement and retention
	Ensure compliance with HR polices and Nigerian labor regulations, including the Labour Act, National Industrial Court guidelines, and industry-specific standards for FMCG.
	Oversee office management, including procurement of supplies, maintenance of office equipment, and coordination with vendors for services like IT support, cleaning, and security.
	Manage warehouse administrative tasks, such as inventory tracking support, logistics coordination, and documentation for shipments in line with Nigerian Customs and Excise regulations.
	Support e-commerce and social media operations by assisting with administrative aspects, such as coordinating content schedules, managing digital asset files, and ensuring data privacy compliance under Nigeria&#39;s Data Protection Regulation (NDPR).
	Handle travel arrangements, event planning (e.g., company meetings or product launches).
	Prepare reports and analytics on HR metrics (e.g., staff turnover, absenteeism) and administrative efficiencies using tools like Excel or Google Sheets.
	Assist in budget preparation for all departments, monitoring expenses to ensure cost-effectiveness in a growing company.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1-3 years in HR and administrative roles, preferably in the FMCG sector or a company with e-commerce and logistics components.
	A professional certification such as CIPM (Chartered Institute of Personnel Management of Nigeria)
	High level of integrity, empathy, and cultural sensitivity. Ability to work independently while being a team player. Flexibility to adapt to the dynamic needs of an FMCG company with online and physical operations


Others:


	Proven experience as an HR Generalist or in a similar HR support role.
	Good knowledge of HR processes, labor laws, and best practices.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills with attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently in a remote environment.
	Proficiency with HR software and MS Office tools.


Salary
N120,000 - N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to:&nbsp;recruitment@faveconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Operations Manager Job at Respected Solutions & Investment




        
    

        
        Respected Solutions & Investment is a leading loan, Investment and pawn company in Nigeria, providing quick and reliable loans against cars, gold, luxury watches, gadgets, and other valuables. Whether you require a loan against gold, luxury watch, jewelry, or even a against car, we provide competitive interest rates and easy repayment options. Our government approved and licensed services guarantee a secure and trustworthy borrowing experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities

	Oversee and coordinate all daily operational activities.
	Lead, mentor, and manage cross-functional teams to achieve operational goals.
	Develop, document, and implement efficient operational processes.
	Monitor performance metrics and prepare regular operational reports.
	Ensure full compliance with company policies and industry standards.
	Manage vendor relationships, procurement, and logistics when required.
	Identify operational gaps, propose improvements, and execute solutions.
	Collaborate closely with senior management to drive strategic growth.


Requirements


	8–10 years proven experience in operations management or similar leadership roles.
	Strong track record of managing teams and overseeing complex operations.
	Excellent organizational and project management skills.
	Strong analytical abilities and decision-making skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and reporting tools.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
	Proximity to Lekki–Ikota is mandatory.


Preferred Attributes:


	Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity and professionalism.
	Strong negotiation and vendor management capabilities.


Salary
N500,000 / month. 

Method of Application

	Eudora & Aegle, on behalf of our client; ANC Microfinance Bank, is seeking a strategic and results-oriented professional to join its leadership team as a Business Development and Financial Strategy Manager.
	This pivotal role is designed for an individual capable of driving sustainable growth, enhancing profitability, and strengthening the bank’s competitive position in the market.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for shaping business strategy, developing innovative financial products, and forging strategic partnerships—all within the regulatory framework of the Central Bank of Nigeria.


Responsibilities


	Formulate and execute comprehensive business development and financial strategies aligned with the bank’s long-term objectives.
	Research, design, and launch customer-centric financial products (loans, savings, digital solutions) for MSMEs, cooperatives, and retail segments.
	Conduct in-depth financial analysis, revenue forecasting, and cost optimization to improve profitability and operational efficiency.
	Lead customer acquisition and retention initiatives through targeted marketing, stakeholder engagement, and superior service delivery.
	Identify and secure collaborations with development finance institutions, investors, NGOs, and other relevant bodies to expand funding and market reach.
	Collaborate with IT and Operations teams to enhance digital banking platforms, automate processes, and improve overall customer experience.
	Work closely with the Credit and Risk departments to ensure business expansion aligns with sound risk management practices and regulatory compliance.


Requirements


	A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field. An MBA, MSc, or relevant professional certification (e.g., ACA, ACCA, CFA) is highly desirable.

	Strong financial modelling, data analysis, and strategic planning skills.
	Familiarity with digital financial services, fintech trends, and technology-driven business models.
	Demonstrated ability to build and maintain partnerships with diverse stakeholders, including investors and development organizations.
